intro: Dasystephana parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved star-leaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
